text: Joseph William Kittinger II (July 27, 1928 â€“ December 9, 2022) was a Colonel in the United States Air Force and a USAF Command Pilot. He was born in Tampa, Florida. He set a world record for the longest skydive from a height more than . He was also the first man to cross the Atlantic Ocean, alone, in a hot air balloon. He was a fighter pilot in the Vietnam War and was a prisoner of war in a North Vietnamese prison. Kittinger died at the age of 94 on December 9, 2022, from lung cancer. ==References== Category:1928 births Category:2022 deaths Category:American aviators Category:American military personnel of the Vietnam War Category:American colonels Category:Military people from Florida Category:People from Tampa, Florida Category:Prisoners of war
title: Joe Kittinger
